intro: Ricinocarpus samydifolius, commonly known as the broad-leafed ricin tree, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by woody pods containing toxic seeds, which contain the potent toxin ricin. It is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in humid, lowland areas. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
